verses.kjv: Then sang Deborah and Barak the son of Abinoam on that day, saying,
verses.web: Then Deborah and Barak the son of Abinoam sang on that day, saying,
verses.ct: On that day, Deborah and Barak son of Abinoam sang this song:

verses.kjv: Praise ye the LORD for the avenging of Israel, when the people willingly offered themselves.
verses.web: “Because the leaders took the lead in Israel, because the people offered themselves willingly, be blessed, LORD!
verses.ct: "Praise the LORD! Israel's leaders stepped up to lead, and the people volunteered willingly for battle.

verses.kjv: Hear, O ye kings; give ear, O ye princes; I, even I, will sing unto the LORD; I will sing praise to the LORD God of Israel.
verses.web: “Hear, you kings! Give ear, you princes! I, even I, will sing to LORD. I will sing praise to LORD, the God of Israel.
verses.ct: Listen, you kings! Pay attention, you rulers! I — yes, I myself — will sing to the LORD. I will sing praise to the LORD, the God of Israel.

verses.kjv: LORD, when thou wentest out of Seir, when thou marchedst out of the field of Edom, the earth trembled, and the heavens dropped, the clouds also dropped water.
verses.web: “LORD, when you went out of Seir, when you marched out of the field of Edom, the earth trembled, the sky also dropped. Yes, the clouds dropped water.
verses.ct: LORD, when you marched out from Seir, when you advanced from the fields of Edom, the earth trembled, the heavens poured down, and the clouds released their rain.

verses.kjv: The mountains melted from before the LORD, even that Sinai from before the LORD God of Israel.
verses.web: The mountains quaked LORD’s presence, even Sinai at the presence of LORD, the God of Israel.
verses.ct: The mountains shook before the LORD — even Sinai trembled before the LORD, the God of Israel.

verses.kjv: In the days of Shamgar the son of Anath, in the days of Jael, the highways were unoccupied, and the travellers walked through byways.
verses.web: “In the days of Shamgar the son of Anath, in the days of Jael, the highways were unoccupied. The travelers walked through byways.
verses.ct: In the days of Shamgar son of Anath, in the days of Jael, the main roads were deserted. Travelers had to sneak along back paths.

verses.kjv: The inhabitants of the villages ceased, they ceased in Israel, until that I Deborah arose, that I arose a mother in Israel.
verses.web: The rulers ceased in Israel. They ceased until I, Deborah, arose; Until I arose a mother in Israel.
verses.ct: Village life in Israel had come to a stop — completely dried up — until I, Deborah, rose up, until I rose as a mother in Israel.

verses.kjv: They chose new gods; then was war in the gates: was there a shield or spear seen among forty thousand in Israel?
verses.web: They chose new gods. Then war was in the gates. Was there a shield or spear seen among forty thousand in Israel?
verses.ct: The people chose new gods, and then war came right to their gates. Among 40,000 men in Israel, could you find a single shield or spear?

verses.kjv: My heart is toward the governors of Israel, that offered themselves willingly among the people. Bless ye the LORD.
verses.web: My heart is toward the governors of Israel, who offered themselves willingly among the people. Bless LORD!
verses.ct: My heart goes out to the commanders of Israel who volunteered willingly among the people. Bless the LORD!

verses.kjv: Speak, ye that ride on white asses, ye that sit in judgment, and walk by the way.
verses.web: “Speak, you who ride on white donkeys, you who sit on rich carpets, and you who walk by the way.
verses.ct: Speak up, you who ride on white donkeys, you who sit on fine saddle blankets, and you who walk along the road!

verses.kjv: They that are delivered from the noise of archers in the places of drawing water, there shall they rehearse the righteous acts of the LORD, even the righteous acts toward the inhabitants of his villages in Israel: then shall the people of the LORD go down to the gates.
verses.web: Far from the noise of archers, in the places of drawing water, there they will rehearse LORD’s righteous acts, the righteous acts of his rule in Israel. “Then LORD’s people went down to the gates.
verses.ct: At the watering places, far from the shouts of enemy archers, the people will retell the righteous acts of the LORD — his righteous deeds for the villages of Israel. Then the LORD's people marched down to the gates.

verses.kjv: Awake, awake, Deborah: awake, awake, utter a song: arise, Barak, and lead thy captivity captive, thou son of Abinoam.
verses.web: ‘Awake, awake, Deborah! Awake, awake, utter a song! Arise, Barak, and lead away your captives, you son of Abinoam.’
verses.ct: 'Wake up, wake up, Deborah! Wake up, wake up, and sing your song! Rise up, Barak son of Abinoam — seize your captives and lead them away!'

verses.kjv: Then he made him that remaineth have dominion over the nobles among the people: the LORD made me have dominion over the mighty.
verses.web: “Then a remnant of the nobles and the people came down. LORD came down for me against the mighty.
verses.ct: Then the survivors came down to join the nobles; the LORD's people came down to me against the mighty.

verses.kjv: Out of Ephraim was there a root of them against Amalek; after thee, Benjamin, among thy people; out of Machir came down governors, and out of Zebulun they that handle the pen of the writer.
verses.web: Those whose root is in Amalek came out of Ephraim, after you, Benjamin, among your peoples. Governors come down out of Machir. Those who handle the marshal’s staff came out of Zebulun.
verses.ct: From Ephraim came those with roots in the land of Amalek; behind you came Benjamin with your forces. From Machir the commanders marched down, and from Zebulun came those who carry the officer's staff.

verses.kjv: And the princes of Issachar were with Deborah; even Issachar, and also Barak: he was sent on foot into the valley. For the divisions of Reuben there were great thoughts of heart.
verses.web: The princes of Issachar were with Deborah. As was Issachar, so was Barak. They rushed into the valley at his feet. By the watercourses of Reuben, there were great resolves of heart.
verses.ct: The princes of Issachar stood with Deborah; Issachar was loyal to Barak. They rushed into the valley right behind him. But among the clans of Reuben, there was deep soul-searching.

verses.kjv: Why abodest thou among the sheepfolds, to hear the bleatings of the flocks? For the divisions of Reuben there were great searchings of heart.
verses.web: Why did you sit among the sheepfolds? To hear the whistling for the flocks? At the watercourses of Reuben, there were great searchings of heart.
verses.ct: Why did you stay behind among the sheepfolds, listening to shepherds whistle for their flocks? Among the clans of Reuben, there was deep soul-searching.

verses.kjv: Gilead abode beyond Jordan: and why did Dan remain in ships? Asher continued on the sea shore, and abode in his breaches.
verses.web: Gilead lived beyond the Jordan. Why did Dan remain in ships? Asher sat still at the haven of the sea, and lived by his creeks.
verses.ct: Gilead stayed beyond the Jordan. And why did Dan linger by his ships? Asher sat idle on the seacoast, settled along his harbors.

verses.kjv: Zebulun and Naphtali were a people that jeoparded their lives unto the death in the high places of the field.
verses.web: Zebulun was a people that jeopardized their lives to the death; Naphtali also, on the high places of the field.
verses.ct: But Zebulun — those were people who risked their lives to the point of death. So did Naphtali, on the heights of the battlefield.

verses.kjv: The kings came and fought, then fought the kings of Canaan in Taanach by the waters of Megiddo; they took no gain of money.
verses.web: “The kings came and fought, then the kings of Canaan fought at Taanach by the waters of Megiddo. They took no plunder of silver.
verses.ct: Kings came and fought — the kings of Canaan fought at Taanach, by the waters of Megiddo. But they carried off no silver plunder.

verses.kjv: They fought from heaven; the stars in their courses fought against Sisera.
verses.web: From the sky the stars fought. From their courses, they fought against Sisera.
verses.ct: The stars fought from heaven; from their paths across the sky, they fought against Sisera.

verses.kjv: The river of Kishon swept them away, that ancient river, the river Kishon. O my soul, thou hast trodden down strength.
verses.web: The river Kishon swept them away, that ancient river, the river Kishon. My soul, march on with strength.
verses.ct: The river Kishon swept them away — that ancient river, the Kishon. March on, my soul, with strength!

verses.kjv: Then were the horsehoofs broken by the means of the pransings, the pransings of their mighty ones.
verses.web: Then the horse hoofs stamped because of the prancing, the prancing of their strong ones.
verses.ct: Then the horses' hooves pounded the ground — galloping, galloping — as their mighty stallions charged.

verses.kjv: Curse ye Meroz, said the angel of the LORD, curse ye bitterly the inhabitants thereof; because they came not to the help of the LORD, to the help of the LORD against the mighty.
verses.web: ‘Curse Meroz,’ said LORD’s angel. ‘Curse bitterly its inhabitants, because they didn’t come to help LORD, to help LORD against the mighty.’
verses.ct: 'Curse Meroz!' said the angel of the LORD. 'Curse its people bitterly, because they did not come to help the LORD — to help the LORD against the mighty.'

verses.kjv: Blessed above women shall Jael the wife of Heber the Kenite be, blessed shall she be above women in the tent.
verses.web: “Jael shall be blessed above women, the wife of Heber the Kenite; blessed shall she be above women in the tent.
verses.ct: Most blessed among women is Jael, the wife of Heber the Kenite — most blessed of women who dwell in tents.

verses.kjv: He asked water, and she gave him milk; she brought forth butter in a lordly dish.
verses.web: He asked for water. She gave him milk. She brought him butter in a lordly dish.
verses.ct: Sisera asked for water, and she gave him milk. She brought him cream in a beautiful bowl.

verses.kjv: She put her hand to the nail, and her right hand to the workmen’s hammer; and with the hammer she smote Sisera, she smote off his head, when she had pierced and stricken through his temples.
verses.web: She put her hand to the tent peg, and her right hand to the workmen’s hammer. With the hammer she struck Sisera. She struck through his head. Yes, she pierced and struck through his temples.
verses.ct: She reached for a tent peg with one hand and a workman's hammer with the other. She struck Sisera, crushed his head, and drove the peg straight through his temples.

verses.kjv: At her feet he bowed, he fell, he lay down: at her feet he bowed, he fell: where he bowed, there he fell down dead.
verses.web: At her feet he bowed, he fell, he lay. At her feet he bowed, he fell. Where he bowed, there he fell down dead.
verses.ct: At her feet he crumpled, he collapsed, he lay still. At her feet he crumpled, he collapsed. Right where he crumpled, there he fell — dead.

verses.kjv: The mother of Sisera looked out at a window, and cried through the lattice, Why is his chariot so long in coming? why tarry the wheels of his chariots?
verses.web: “Through the window she looked out, and cried: Sisera’s mother looked through the lattice. ‘Why is his chariot so long in coming? Why do the wheels of his chariots wait?’
verses.ct: Sisera's mother peered through the window and cried out through the lattice, 'Why is his chariot taking so long to come? Why are the hoofbeats of his horses delayed?'

verses.kjv: Her wise ladies answered her, yea, she returned answer to herself,
verses.web: Her wise ladies answered her, Yes, she returned answer to herself,
verses.ct: Her wisest attendants answered her, and she kept repeating their words to herself:

verses.kjv: Have they not sped? have they not divided the prey; to every man a damsel or two; to Sisera a prey of divers colours, a prey of divers colours of needlework, of divers colours of needlework on both sides, meet for the necks of them that take the spoil?
verses.web: ‘Have they not found, have they not divided the plunder? A lady, two ladies to every man; to Sisera a plunder of dyed garments, a plunder of dyed garments embroidered, of dyed garments embroidered on both sides, on the necks of the plunder?’
verses.ct: 'They must be finding and dividing the plunder — a girl or two for every soldier, colorful garments for Sisera, beautifully embroidered cloth, richly embroidered fabric for the necks of those who take the spoil.'

verses.kjv: So let all thine enemies perish, O LORD: but let them that love him be as the sun when he goeth forth in his might. And the land had rest forty years.
verses.web: “So let all your enemies perish, LORD, but let those who love him be as the sun when it rises in its strength.” Then the land had rest forty years.
verses.ct: "So let all your enemies perish, LORD! But let those who love him shine like the sun rising in full strength." After this, the land had peace for 40 years.
